meanings.definition: A buoyant belt or device worn to prevent drowning.
meanings.sent1: The lifebelt kept the swimmer afloat in the water.
meanings.sent2: It is important to always have a lifebelt on a boat for safety.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy mistook the lifebelt for a toy and tried to play with it.
meanings.sent4: Her optimism was like a lifebelt, keeping her afloat during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange color of the lifebelt made it easy to spot in the water.

meanings.definition: A life preserver in the form of a ring.
meanings.sent1: The lifebelt was thrown to the struggling swimmer to help them stay above water.
meanings.sent2: The captain made sure there was a lifebelt for each passenger on the boat.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull tried to steal the lifebelt thinking it was food.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a lifebelt, bringing comfort and support to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The lifebelt was a symbol of safety and security during the ocean voyage.
